titleStmt.title: William Pugh et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7323

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Governer of Kentucky the undersigned petitioners of Boyd County Kentucky would respectfully represent that at the October term of the Boyd Circuit Court judgments wer rendered against Col John L Zeigler for fifty dollars for selling liquor to a minor and sixty dolls for Keeping a tipling House we are well acquainted with Col Ziegler and Know him to be a cleaver good man he has now license to Keep a Coffee house for which he has had to pay Two hundred and ten dollars we therefore pray you Excellency to remitt said fines

Wm Pugh
Thos J. Ewing
Jasper Bowling
Jas. R Finn
K N Harris
J Frainor King
V. Reinhart
John
John Johnson
Jas Brise
B Burk
Laban T Moore
J. D. Jones

Boyd Cir Ct
vs
John L Zeigler
2 judgts
one for $60 Tipling ^House^
one for $50 Selg to Mr
Remitted 10 Nov/65
